title: Development of Covariational Reasoning in Trigonometry: Design-Based Research and Dynamic Visualization

context.prior_knowledge: Basic trigonometric function concepts (sin, cos, tan graphs) and understanding of coordinate planes
context.additional_context: Implements personalized digital tool utilization (BYOD) and project-based assessments per learner

learning_goals: Learners can visualize dynamic changes in trigonometric functions to explain continuous covariation between variables.
Learners can accurately perform the transformation process between trigonometric function graphs, tables, and situational modeling using GeoGebra applets with at least 80% accuracy.
Learners can complete a mathematical modeling project for real-world problems (e.g., simple harmonic motion) by applying covariational reasoning steps.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
